content: reversible double-thickness mittens by beverly tilton materials ● approx 350-500 yds worsted weight yarn depending on size made ● size 5 circular needle ● 3 stitch markers ● scrap yarn ● yarn needle gauge 5 stitches/inch in stockinette stitch on size 5 needles abbreviations co -- cast on bobble -- bind off k -- knit p -- purl pu -- pick up st st -- stockinette stitch st s -- stitch es round -- round pm -- place marker sm -- slip marker increase -- increase decrease -- decrease m1 -- make 1 using backwards e method or your favorite m1 k2tog -- knit 2 together notes sizes 5 -6 6 -7 7 -8 around knuckles changes for larger sizes are in parenthesis mittens are knit using magic loop method and are knit from tip to tip if you are not familiar with magic loop judy s magic cast-on kitchener or crocheted provisional cast-on you can find directions for these techniques on knitpicks or youtube instructions ● co 20 stitches using judy s magic cast-on 10 sts on each needle fingers ● round 1 k every st ● round 2 1st side k1 pm this marker is to indicate beginning of round slip this marker whenever you come to it m1 knit to one st before end of side m1 k1 2nd side repeat first side ● repeat rnds 1 & 2 until there are 40 44 48 sts total © beverly tilton beverly is yarn crazy1 reversible double-thickness mittens by beverly tilton ● k every st for 3 5 4 5 inches thumb gusset ● round 1 k to end of first side pm beginning of thumb gusset sts using a provisional cast-on i used crocheted provisional cast-on and scrap yarn cast on 6 8 10 sts to first side moving to second side of the round continue casting-on 6 8 10 more sts pm end of thumb gusset sts then knit the rest of the round ● round 2 & 3 k all stitches ● round 4 k to 2nd marker sm k2tog knit to 3rd marker k2tog sm knit to end of round ● repeat rnds 2 3 & 4 until all the gusset sts are used up and you are back to the 40 44 48 sts removing the 2nd and 3rd markers at that time cuffs ● k every st for 3 rounds ● k 6 inches of ribbing produces 3 inch cuff knit more or less ribbing here for longer or shorter cuffs if you desire 2 different colored mittens then change yarn colors halfway through the ribbing ● k every st for 3 rounds thumb gusset ● round 1 1st side knit to end pm start of thumb gusset sts m1 2nd side m1 pm end of thumb gusset sts knit to end ● round 2 & 3 k every st ● repeat rnds 1 2 & 3
